meanings.definition: The quality or state of being villainous.
meanings.sent1: Her villainousness was evident in the way she plotted against the hero.
meanings.sent2: The movie's plot was driven by the villainousness of the main character.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character's villainousness made the audience laugh at his failed attempts to be bad.
meanings.sent4: The villainousness of the storm clouds foretold a night of thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent5: The villainousness of the witch's cackle sent shivers down everyone's spines.

meanings.definition: The behavior or actions of a villain.
meanings.sent1: His villainousness was on full display as he cackled and twirled his mustache.
meanings.sent2: The hero was always one step ahead of the villainousness of the antagonist.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's villainousness was evident when he stole a sock and ran around the house with it.
meanings.sent4: The villainousness of the cat knocking over the vase was met with a stern scolding.
meanings.sent5: The villainousness of the dragon's fiery breath scorched the village to ashes.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being evil or wicked.
meanings.sent1: The king's villainousness was known throughout the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The fairy tale was filled with the villainousness of the evil queen.
meanings.sent3: The villainousness of the cookie thief was revealed when crumbs led to their hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The villainousness of the haunted house sent chills down the spines of all who dared to enter.
meanings.sent5: The villainousness of the dark forest was whispered about in hushed tones by the villagers.
